project.name: Entropy
project.description: JavaScript entity system for writing games.

Entropy.name: Entropy
Entropy.description: Main Entropy module and top namespace.

Engine.name: Engine
Engine.description: Engine class. Class is used internaly. User should not instatiate this class.

Entity.name: Entity
Entity.description: Entity class. Class is used internaly. User should not instatiate this class.

Game.name: Game
Game.description: Main framework class. This is the only class, that needs to be instatiated by user.

Query.name: Query
Query.description:
Used to perform matching of entities.
Only parameter is an array of component names to include or object with `include` and/or `exclude` properties,
witch are arrays of component names to respectively include and/or exclude.

State.name: State
State.description: This class is an implementation of simple state manager.

Entropy.name: Entropy
Entropy.description: Main static framework. Used as top namespace.

classitems.description: Instance of {{#crossLink "Game"}}Game{{/crossLink}} class.
classitems.name: game

classitems.description:
Indicates the greatest entity ID present in the system.
Used to generate new IDs.
classitems.name: _gratestEntityID

classitems.description: Pool of currently not used entity IDs. Will be reused.
classitems.name: _idsToReuse

classitems.description: Systems that are processed every tick.
classitems.name: _systems

classitems.description: Array with entities. Array index corresponds to ID of an entity.
classitems.name: _entities

classitems.description: Initialize components and entities pools.

Registers new component pattern.
Only argument should be an object with obligatory `name` property and `initialize` method.
This method is used to assign some data to component object. `this` inside `initialize` function is a
reference to newly created component object.
classitems.name: Component

classitems.description:
Registers new entity pattern.

Pattern is an object with following properties:
 - __name__ (required) - name of an entity
 - __create__ (required) - method called when creating new entity. Here you should add initial components to an entity.
  `this` inside function references newly created entity object (instance of {{#crossLink "Entity"}}Entity{{/crossLink}} class).
  Function is called with first argument being `game` object and every others are parameters with witch {{#crossLink "Engine/create:method"}}create{{/crossLink}} method is called.
 - __remove__ (optional) - method called when entity is removed from the system. This is good place to clean after entity (ex. remove some resources from renderer).
  First and only argument is a `game` object.
classitems.name: Entity

classitems.description: Registers new system pattern.
classitems.name: System

classitems.description:
Used to perform matching of entities.
Only parameter is an array of component names to include or object with `include` and/or `exclude` properties,
witch are arrays of component names to respectively include and/or exclude.
classitems.name: Query

classitems.description:
Creates new entity using pattern identified by `name` parameter.
Every additional parameter will be applied to patterns `create` method.
Patterns `create` method is called imediatelly after calling this method.
classitems.name: create

params.name: name
params.description: first argument is a name of entity (entity pattern). Every additional argument will be applied to patterns `create` method.

classitems.description:
Removes entity from engine.
Entity removal does not happen imediatelly, but after current update cycle.
classitems.name: remove

classitems.description:
Returns array of entities satisfying given {{#crossLink "Query"}}query{{/crossLink}} conditions.
Returned arrays length does not correspond with matched entities quantity.
To loop over entities start from 0 index, and then check if element is different than 0.
This method guaranties, that entities will be arranged as subsequent array slice, starting from 0 index and ending on element equal to 0.
The array is in this form for performance reasons.
classitems.name: getEntities

classitems.description:
Creates new system object and adds it to the engine. System patterns `initialize` method is called (if present).
It can be called in two ways - with first argument being either:
- system name - then system has priority as defined by patterns `priority` property or 0.
- array with two elements - system name and its desired priority. In this case patterns `priority` property is simply skiped.
classitems.name: addSystem

params.name: name
params.description: name of a system or array with two elements - name of a system and desired priority (see example). Additional arguments are applied to patterns `initialize` method.

classitems.description: Removing entities.
Adding entities.
Modifying entities.
Removing systems.
Adding systems.
Fetching query indexes.
Returns ID for an entity. Reuses old IDs or creates new.
Initializes new query. Performs initial entity search.

Adds new component to an entity. Component is either created from scratch or reused from pool. In later case, component patterns `reset` method is called (if present).\
Component patterns `initialize` method is called with additional arguments passed to `add` method.
Addition does not happen imediately, but is postponed to nearest update cycle.
classitems.name: add

params.name: name
params.description: name of component to add. Addidtional parameters are applied to component patterns `initialize` method.

classitems.description:
Instance of Inverse class.
How to use:
[https://github.com/mcordingley/Inverse.js](https://github.com/mcordingley/Inverse.js)
classitems.name: container

classitems.description: Instance of Ticker class.
classitems.name: ticker

classitems.description: Registers new state. This method simply calls State's {{#crossLink "State/Register:method"}}Register{{/crossLink}} static method.
classitems.name: State

classitems.description: Starts the game. See Ticker's {{#crossLink "Ticker/start:method"}}start{{/crossLink}} method for more details.
classitems.name: start

classitems.description: Stops the game. See Ticker's {{#crossLink "Ticker/stop:method"}}stop{{/crossLink}} method for more details.
classitems.name: stop

classitems.description: Pauses the game. See Ticker's {{#crossLink "Ticker/pause:method"}}pause{{/crossLink}} method for more details.
classitems.name: pause

classitems.description: Resumes the game. See Ticker's {{#crossLink "Ticker/resume:method"}}resume{{/crossLink}} method for more details.
classitems.name: resume

classitems.description: Puts value in the pool. Named pool, because it is used to implement pooling of various object in engine.
classitems.name: put

classitems.description: Gets value from the pool. Returns last put value.
classitems.name: get

classitems.description: Returns current size of the pool (not maximum size).
classitems.name: size

classitems.description:
Changes state to one identified by `name` parameter.
Changing state process looks roughly like this:
 1. calling current state's `exit` method (if present)
 2. calling next state's `initialize` method (if present)
 3. calling transition function (if present)
 4. calling next state's `enter` method (if present)
classitems.name: change

params.name: name
params.description: state to change into. Any addidtional parameter will be applied to transition method.

classitems.description: Returns name of the current state.
classitems.name: current

classitems.description: Checks whether state machine is in state identified by name.
classitems.name: isIn

classitems.description: Registers new state. Registered states are shared between State instances.
classitems.name: Register

classitems.description: Fires when ticker starts ticking.
classitems.name: start

classitems.description: Fires when ticker stops ticking.
classitems.name: stop

classitems.description:
Running ticker is a ticker that constantly calls its timer function.
Paused ticker is also running.
classitems.name: isRunning

classitems.description: Turns __on__ or __off__ debugging features (FPS meter, frame time meter etc.).
classitems.name: debug

classitems.description:
Assignes new property to main Entropy namespace identified by key (uppercased).
Once assigned, can't be assigned again.
Can be later accessed by: Entropy.KEY
classitems.name: Const

classitems.description: {{#crossLink "Game"}}Game{{/crossLink}} class reference.
classitems.name: Game

classitems.description: {{#crossLink "Engine"}}Engine{{/crossLink}} class reference.
classitems.name: Engine
